questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel, located in the Middle East, holds the title of the tallest building in the world as of 2023?
questions.context: The construction of this impressive skyscraper was completed in 2010 and it stands at 828 meters tall, offering breathtaking views of the surrounding city.

questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in Italy is home to the famous Leaning Tower, a symbol of medieval European architecture?
questions.context: The tower began to lean during construction in the 12th century due to soft ground, and it underwent stabilization work in the late 20th century.

questions.question: Which famous museum in France houses the Mona Lisa and is one of the largest and most visited museums in the world?
questions.context: Originally a fortress in the 12th century, the Louvre became a royal palace and has been a public museum since 1793.

questions.question: What ancient ruins in Greece, located on an elevated rocky outcrop, include the Parthenon and stand as a symbol of Ancient Greek civilization?
questions.context: The Acropolis showcases classical architecture and has been standing since the 5th century BC, witnessing the golden age of Athens.

questions.question: Which historical battle site in Belgium, known for a decisive defeat of Napoleon Bonaparte in 1815, can be explored at the Memorial 1815 museum?
questions.context: The Battle of Waterloo marked the end of the Napoleonic Wars and saw Napoleon defeated by the Duke of Wellington and his allies.
